question.title: ENGINE COMPRESSOR STALL
question.line: An engine compressor stall is normally recognized by a noticeable bang or popping noise and possible aircraft yaw.
These responses are normally accompanied by the rapid increase in tgt temp and fluctuations in ng speed; % trq; and % rpm for the affected engine.
In the event of a compressor stall:
2. eng power cont lever (affected engine) - retard. (TGT TEMP should decrease)
3. ENG POWER CONT lever (affected engine) - FLY
6. Refer to single engine failure emergency procedure

question.title: WHAT IS THE AIRSPEED OF AN UNLADEN FALCON
